info.name: Weapons
info.description: Weapons from Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Boat Oar
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Boomerang
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Butterfly Staff
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Fan
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Frying Pan
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Iron Tea Kettle
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Shovel
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Umbrella
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Bellow Flute
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: The traditional Obojiman instrument has gotten a second life as a swift club-like weapon commonly used by traveling performers. It is crafted from a special coral found all across the shallows, which naturally forms with dozens of tiny holes that run throughout the body of the instrumental weapon. When swung it emits a beautiful harmonic sound.

element.name: Candlemaker's Club
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: These heavy honey dipper shaped clubs are traditionally used for mixing the giant vats of wax used by the Courier Brigade to seal packages and craft candles. They're now used by postal knights and adventurers as a useful defensive and offensive tool.

element.name: Dandelion Spear
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: This strange and intimidating weapon was made for fishing in the reefs and crags of the Shallows. Its long haft is tipped with a spherical array of thin sharp barbs, which gave the spear its title, as its silhouette is reminiscent of a blooming dandelion.

element.name: Drive Shaft
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Lom Lom Dagger
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: The short and angular blade of a lom lom dagger was designed for cleaving and quickly became a staple in most of Obojima's kitchens. Over time, the blade length grew longer and longer, and eventually the lom lom dagger made its way out of the kitchen and into the hands of adventurers, who favored it for its balance and accuracy when thrown.

element.name: Secret Stone Sword
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: Although it's not much of a secret nowadays, the magical stone known as feather rock, which is used to craft these stone swords, was once coveted and kept hidden by the Nakudama. Even though feather rock is now commonly used by potion brewers, and the craft of making one of these swords is fairly common, the name has stayed the same.

element.name: Shepherd Crook
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Tapper Sack
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Vertebrae Sword
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: The jagged vertebrae sword of a fishfolk warrior can barely be called a sword. Locals would say it's better described as a makeshift weapon crafted from a fish skeleton and sea trash. Its poor construction is the reason it's not often a weapon seen on land, though when used by a skilled fighter, it most certainly can be a formidable tool.

element.name: Vaulter's Axe
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: The vaulter's axe was designed by the Rangers of the Greenward Path for exploring the Brackwater Wetlands. Its tall haft allows wielders of the axe to easily check water depths and vault over obstacles. To this day it's a useful tool for anyone exploring the eastern side of the island.

element.name: Field Spear
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: Also known as the merchant's blade, the field spear was proven a useful and sturdy tool by the hundreds of merchants and travelers that use it in their expeditions across the island. Its shorter haft is roughly half the size of a standard spear and its tip is more similar to a wide blade or dagger than the traditional spear tip.

element.name: Nakudama Bubble Rod
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: The Nakudama bubble rod is most recognizable by the curious sounds it produces when used. The wet descending whistle of multiple water filled glass marbles shot from the end of the oblong tube, quickly followed by the unmistakable pop of the ammunition as they hit their target.

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Nakudama Bubble Rod)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

element.name: Special (Boomerang)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: When thrown, the boomerang returns to an unoccupied space adjacent to you. As a reaction, you can choose to catch it.

element.name: Special (Butterfly Staff)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: When you make a grapple check while holding the butterfly staff, you can use the staff to target a Small or smaller creature that is up to 10 feet away from you. When you do so, you use your attack modifier for the weapon in place of your Strength (Athletics) check. While grappling a creature in this way, you can't make another attack with the butterfly staff.

element.name: Special (Fan)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: When you're hit by a ranged weapon attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the incoming damage of the attack by a number equal to your Dexterity modifier.

element.name: Special (Frying Pan)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: When wielding a frying pan, you can use your bonus action to add a +1 bonus to your AC until the end of your next turn. You can't gain this benefit while wielding a shield.

element.name: Special (Umbrella)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: Whenever you take falling damage while wielding an umbrella, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by a number equal to twice your proficiency bonus.

element.name: Special (Candlemaker's Club)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: While wielding a candlemaker's club, you can use a bonus action to extinguish a flame within 5 feet of you.

element.name: Special (Shepherd Crook)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: As a bonus action, you can make a contested Strength check against a creature within range, moving the target to another unoccupied space within 5 feet of you on a success.

element.name: Special (Vertebrae Sword)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: When you successfully hit a creature with a vertebrae sword, you can use a bonus action to rake and twist the weapon, breaking off some of the sword's boney barbs and dealing an extra 1d8 piercing damage. The vertebrae sword can only be used in this way 5 times before it becomes unusable as a weapon.

element.name: Special (Vaulter's Axe)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: As part of your movement, you can use the vaulter's axe to launch yourself 15 feet over a creature or obstacle. Using your movement in this way ignores nonmagical difficult terrain.

element.name: Kensei Weapon (Boat Oar)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: You gain proficiency with the Boat Oar if you don’t already have it, and it is a monk weapon for you.

element.name: Kensei Weapon (Iron Tea Kettle)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: You gain proficiency with the Iron Tea Kettle if you don’t already have it, and it is a monk weapon for you.

element.name: Kensei Weapon (Shovel)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: You gain proficiency with the Shovel if you don’t already have it, and it is a monk weapon for you.

description.p: You gain proficiency with the Bellow Flute if you don’t already have it, and it is a monk weapon for you.

element.name: Kensei Weapon (Lom Lom Dagger)
element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: You gain proficiency with the Lom Lom Dagger if you don’t already have it, and it is a monk weapon for you.

element.name: Kensei Weapon (Secret Stone Sword)

description.p: You gain proficiency with the Secret Stone Sword if you don’t already have it, and it is a monk weapon for you.

element.source: Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass

description.p: You gain proficiency with the Tapper Sack if you don’t already have it, and it is a monk weapon for you.

description.p: You gain proficiency with the Field Spear if you don’t already have it, and it is a monk weapon for you.
